ArabicTitle: مِنْ سِفْرِ الْخُرُوجِ لِمُوسَى النَّبِيِّ بَرَكَتُهُ الْمُقَدَّسَةُ فَلْتَكُنْ مَعَنَا. آمين . ( ٤ : ١٩ - ٦: ١٣ )

Hymn.Arabic: وَقَالَ الرَّبُّ لِمُوسَى فِي مِدْيَانَ : " اِمْضِ فَارْجِعْ إِلَى مِصْرَ ، فَإِنَّهُ قَدْ مَاتَ جَمِيعُ الْقَوْمِ الَّذِينَ يَطْلُبُونَ
Hymn.English: 19 And the Lord said to Moses in Midian, Go, return to Egypt; for all the men who sought your life are dead.

Hymn.Arabic: نَفْسَكَ ".
Hymn.English: 20 Then Moses took his wife and his sons and set them on a donkey, and he returned to the land of Egypt. And Moses took the rod of God in his hand.

Hymn.Arabic: فَأَخَذَ مُوسَى امْرَأَتَهُ وَبَنِيهِ وَأَرْكَبَهُمْ عَلَى الْحَمِيرِ وَرَجَعَ إِلَى أَرْضِ مِصْرَ وَأَخَذَ مُوسَى عَصَا اللَّهِ بِيَدِهِ.
Hymn.English: 21 And the Lord said to Moses, When you go back to Egypt, see that you do all those wonders before Pharaoh which I have put in your hand. But I will harden his heart, so that he will not let the people go.

Hymn.Arabic: وَقَالَ الرَّبُّ لِمُوسَى : " إِذَا مَضَيْتَ رَاجِعًا إِلَى مِصْرَ ، فَانْظُرْ جَمِيعَ الْمُعْجِزَاتِ الَّتِي أَوْدَعْتُهَا فِي يَدِكَ
Hymn.English: 22 Then you shall say to Pharaoh, `Thus says the Lord: Israel is My son, My firstborn.

Hymn.Arabic: تَضَعُهَا بَيْنَ يَدَيْ فِرْعَوْنَ وَأَنَا أُقَسِّي قَلْبَهُ فَلَا يُطْلِقُ الشَّعْبَ.
Hymn.English: 23 So I say to you, let My son go that he may serve Me. But if you refuse to let him go, indeed I will kill your son, your firstborn. '

Hymn.Arabic: وَقُلْ لِفِرْعَوْنَ: كَذَا قَالَ الرَّبُّ , إِسْرَائِيلُ ابْنِي الْبِكْرُ.
Hymn.English: 24 And it came to pass on the way, at the encampment, that the Lord met him and sought to kill him.

Hymn.Arabic: قُلْتُ لَكَ: أَطْلِقَ ابْنِي لِيَعْبُدَنِي .وَإِنْ أَبَيْتَ أَنْ تُطْلِقَهُ. فَهَأَنْذَا قَاتِلُ ابْنَكَ الْبِكْرَ ".
Hymn.English: 25 Then Zipporah took a sharp stone and cut off the foreskin of her son and cast it at Moses' feet, and said, Surely you are a husband of blood to me!

Hymn.Arabic: وَلَمَّا كَانَ فِي الطَّرِيقِ فِي الْمَبِيتِ الْتَقَاهُ مَلَاكُ الرَّبِّ فَأَرَادَ قَتْلَهُ.
Hymn.English: 26 So He let him go. Then she said, You are a husband of blood!--because of the circumcision.

Hymn.Arabic: فَأَخَذَتْ صِفُورَةُ صَوَّانَةً وَقَطَعَتْ قُلْفَةَ ابْنِهَا وَمَسَّتْ رِجْلَيْهِ وَقَالَتْ : " إِنَّكَ لِي عَرِيسُ دَمِ ".
Hymn.English: 27 And the Lord said to Aaron, Go into the wilderness to meet Moses. So he went and met him on the mountain of God, and kissed him.

Hymn.Arabic: فَكَفَّ عَنْهُ عِنْدَمَا قَالَتْ : " عَرِيسُ دَمٍ " مِنْ أَجْلِ الْخِتَانِ.
Hymn.English: 28 So Moses told Aaron all the words of the Lord who had sent him, and all the signs which He had commanded him.

Hymn.Arabic: وَقَالَ الرَّبُّ لِهَارُونَ: " امْضِ لِلِقَاءِ مُوسَى فِي الْبَرِّيَّةِ ". فَمَضَى وَلَقِيَهُ فِي جَبَلِ اللَّهِ فَقَبَّلَهُ.
Hymn.English: 29 Then Moses and Aaron went and gathered together all the elders of the children of Israel.

Hymn.Arabic: فَأَخْبَرَ مُوسَى هَارُونَ بِجَمِيعِ كَلَامِ الرَّبِّ الَّذِي بَعَثَهُ بِهِ ، وَجَمِيعِ الْآيَاتِ الَّتِي أَمَرَهُ بِهَا .
Hymn.English: 30 And Aaron spoke all the words which the Lord had spoken to Moses. Then he did the signs in the sight of the people.

Hymn.Arabic: فَمَضَى مُوسَى وَهَارُونُ وَجَمَعَ جَمِيعَ شُيُوخِ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ.
Hymn.English: 31 So the people believed; and when they heard that the Lord had visited the children of Israel and that He had looked on their affliction, then they bowed their heads and worshiped.

Hymn.Arabic: وَخَاطَبَهُمْ هَارُونُ بِجَمِيعِ الْكَلَامِ الَّذِي كَلَّمَ الرَّبُّ بِهِ مُوسَى، وَصَنَعَ الْآيَاتِ عَلَى عُيُونِ الشَّعْبِ.
Hymn.English: 5:1 Afterward Moses and Aaron went in and told Pharaoh, Thus says the Lord God of Israel: `Let My people go, that they may hold a feast to Me in the wilderness.'

Hymn.Arabic: فَآمَنَ الشَّعْبُ. وَإِذْ سَمِعُوا أَنَّ الرَّبَّ قَدِ افْتَقَدَ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ وَنَظَرَ إِلَى مَذَلَّتِهِمْ ، خَرُّوا وَسَجَدُوا .
Hymn.English: 2 And Pharaoh said, Who is the Lord, that I should obey His voice to let Israel go? I do not know the Lord, nor will I let Israel go.

Hymn.Arabic: وَبَعْدَ ذَلِكَ دَخَلَ مُوسَى وَهَارُونُ وَقَالَا لِفِرْعَوْنَ : " كَذَا قَالَ الرَّبُّ إِلَهُ إِسْرَائِيلَ: أَطْلِقْ شَعْبِي لِكَيْ يُعَيِّدُوا
Hymn.English: 3 So they said, The God of the Hebrews has met with us. Please, let us go three days' journey into the desert and sacrifice to the Lord our God, lest He fall upon us with pestilence or with the sword.

Hymn.Arabic: لِي فِي الْبَرِّيَّةِ .".
Hymn.English: 4 Then the king of Egypt said to them, Moses and Aaron, why do you take the people from their work? Get back to your labor.

Hymn.Arabic: فَقَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ : " مَنْ هُوَ الرَّبُّ فَأَسْمَعَ لِقَوْلِهِ وَأَطْلِقَ إِسْرَائِيلَ ؟ لا أعرف الرَّبَّ ، وَلَا أُطلِق إِسْرَائِيلَ ".
Hymn.English: 5 And Pharaoh said, Look, the people of the land are many now, and you make them rest from their labor!

Hymn.Arabic: قَالَا: " إِلهُ الْعِبْرَانِيِّينَ دَعَانَا ، فَنَذْهَبُ مَسِيرَةَ ثَلَاثَةِ أَيَّامٍ فِي الْبَرِّيَّةِ وَنَذْبَحْ لِلرَّبِّ إِلَهِنَا ، لِئَلَّا يُصِيبَنَا بِوَبَاءٍ
Hymn.English: 6 So the same day Pharaoh commanded the taskmasters of the people and their officers, saying,

Hymn.Arabic: أَوْ سَيْف ".
Hymn.English: 7 You shall no longer give the people straw to make brick as before. Let them go and gather straw for themselves.

Hymn.Arabic: فَقَالَ لَهُمَا مَلِكُ مِصْرَ : " لِمَاذَا يَا مُوسَى وَهَارُونُ تُعَطِّلَانِ الشَّعْبَ عَنْ أَعْمَالِهِمْ ؟ اِذْهَبَا إِلَى أَثْقَالِكُمَا ".
Hymn.English: 8 And you shall lay on them the quota of bricks which they made before. You shall not reduce it. For they are idle; therefore they cry out, saying, `Let us go and sacrifice to our God.'

Hymn.Arabic: وَقَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ: " هُوَذَا قَدْ كَثُرَ شَعْبُ الْأَرْضِ فَكَيْفَ إذا أَرَحْتُمَاهُمْ مِنَ الْأَعْمَالَ ".
Hymn.English: 9 Let more work be laid on the men, that they may labor in it, and let them not regard false words.

Hymn.Arabic: وَأَمَرَ فِرْعَوْنُ فِي ذَلِكَ الْيَوْمِ مُسَخَرِي الشَّعْبِ وَمُدَبِرِيهِمْ قَائِلًا: "
Hymn.English: 10 And the taskmasters of the people and their officers went out and spoke to the people, saying, Thus says Pharaoh: `I will not give you straw.

Hymn.Arabic: لَا تُعْطُوا الشَّعْبَ تِبْنَا بَعْدُ لِيَصْنَعُوا اللَّبْنَ مِثْلَ أَمْسِ فَمَا قَبْلُ , بَلْ لِيَذْهَبُوا هُمْ وَيَجْمَعُوا لَهُمْ تِبْنَا.
Hymn.English: 11 `Go, get yourselves straw where you can find it; yet none of your work will be reduced.'

Hymn.Arabic: وَمِقْدَارُ اللَّبْنِ الَّذِي كَانُوا يَصْنَعُونَهُ أَمْس فَمَا قَبْلُ أَفْرِضُوهُ عَلَيْهِمْ ، وَلَا تُنْقِصُوا مِنْهُ شَيْئًا لِأَنَّهُمْ
Hymn.English: 12 So the people were scattered abroad throughout all the land of Egypt to gather stubble instead of straw.

Hymn.Arabic: مُتَرَفَهُونَ ، وَلِذَلِكَ هُمْ يَصْرُخُونَ وَيَقُولُونَ: نَمْضِي وَنَذْبَحُ لِإِلَهِنَا.
Hymn.English: 13 And the taskmasters forced them to hurry, saying, Fulfill your work, your daily quota, as when there was straw.

Hymn.Arabic: لِيُثَقَّلِ الْعَمَلُ عَلَى الشَّعْبِ فَيَشْتَغِلُوا بِهِ وَلَا يَلْتَفِتُوا إِلَى كَلَامِ الْكَذِبِ ".
Hymn.English: 14 Also the officers of the children of Israel, whom Pharaoh's taskmasters had set over them, were beaten and were asked, Why have you not fulfilled your task in making brick both yesterday and today, as before?

Hymn.Arabic: فَخَرَجَ مُسَخِرُو الشَّعْبِ وَمُدَبِّرُوهُمْ وَخَاطَبُوا الشَّعْبَ ، قَائِلِينَ: " كَذَا قَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ: لَسْتُ أُعْطِيكُمْ تِبْنَا
Hymn.English: 15 Then the officers of the children of Israel came and cried out to Pharaoh, saying, Why are you dealing thus with your servants?

Hymn.Arabic: اِمْضُوا أَنْتُمْ وَاجْمَعُوا لَكُمْ تِبْنَا مِنْ حَيْثُ تَجِدُونَ إِنَّهُ لَا يَنْقُصُ مِنْ عَمَلِكُمْ شَيْءٌ ".
Hymn.English: 16 There is no straw given to your servants, and they say to us, `Make brick!' And indeed your servants are beaten, but the fault is in your own people.

Hymn.Arabic: فَتَفَرَّقَ الشَّعْبُ فِي جَمِيعِ أَرْضِ مِصْرَ لِيَجْمَعُوا قَشَّاً عِوَضَ التِّبْنِ.
Hymn.English: 17 But he said, You are idle! Idle! Therefore you say, `Let us go and sacrifice to the Lord.'

Hymn.Arabic: وَالْمُسَخِرُونَ يَلْحُونَ عَلَيْهِمْ قَائِلِينَ: " أَكْمِلُوا أَعْمَالَكُمْ ، فَرِيضَةَ كُلَّ يَوْمٍ فِي يَوْمِهَا ، كَمَا كَانَ وَقْتَ
Hymn.English: 18 Therefore go now and work; for no straw shall be given you, yet you shall deliver the quota of bricks.

Hymn.Arabic: إِعْطَاءِ التِّبْنِ ".
Hymn.English: 19 And the officers of the children of Israel saw that they were in trouble after it was said, You shall not reduce any bricks from your daily quota.

Hymn.Arabic: وَضُرِبَ مُدَبِّرُو بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ الَّذِينَ وَلَّاهُمْ عَلَيْهِمْ مُسَخِرُو فِرْعَوْنَ ، وَقِيلَ لَهُمْ: " مَا بَالُكُمْ لَمْ تُكَمِّلُوا
Hymn.English: 20 Then, as they came out from Pharaoh, they met Moses and Aaron who stood there to meet them.

Hymn.Arabic: فَرِيضَتَكُمْ مِنْ عَمَلِ اللَّبْنِ أَمْسِ وَالْيَوْمَ مِثْلَ أَمْسِ فَمَا قَبْلُ ؟ ".
Hymn.English: 21 And they said to them, Let the Lord look on you and judge, because you have made us abhorrent in the sight of Pharaoh and in the sight of his servants, to put a sword in their hand to kill us.

Hymn.Arabic: فَجَاءَ مُدَبِّرُو بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ وَصَرَحُوا إِلَى فِرْعَوْنَ قَائِلِينَ: " لِمَاذَا تَصْنَعُ بِعَبِيدِكَ هَكَذَا ؟
Hymn.English: 22 So Moses returned to the Lord and said, Lord, why have You brought trouble on this people? Why is it You have sent me?

Hymn.Arabic: إِنَّهُ لَا يُعْطَى لِعَبِيدِكَ تِبْنٌ ، وَهُمْ يَقُولُونَ لَنَا: اِعْمَلُوا لِبْنَاً وَهَا إِنَّ عبيدكَ يُضْرَبُونَ ، وَشَعُبُكَ يُعَامَلُونَ
Hymn.English: 23 For since I came to Pharaoh to speak in Your name, he has done evil to this people; neither have You delivered Your people at all.

Hymn.Arabic: كَمُذْنِبِينَ ".
Hymn.English: 6:1 Then the Lord said to Moses, Now you shall see what I will do to Pharaoh. For with a strong hand he will let them go, and with a strong hand he will drive them out of his land.

Hymn.Arabic: فَقَالَ: " إِنَّمَا أَنْتُمْ مُتَرَفَهُونَ ، وَلِذَلِكَ تَقُولُونَ : نَمُضِي وَنَذْبَحْ لِلرَّتِ.
Hymn.English: 2 And God spoke to Moses and said to him: I am the Lord.

Hymn.Arabic: وَالْآنَ فَامْضُوا اعْمَلُوا وَتُبْنٌ لَا يُعْطَى لَكُمْ وَمِقْدَارُ اللَّبْنِ تُقَدِّمُونَهُ.
Hymn.English: 3 I appeared to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, as God Almighty, but by My name Lord I was not known to them.

Hymn.Arabic: فَرَأَى مُدَبِّرُو بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ أَنْفُسَهُمْ فِي شَقَاءٍ إِذْ قِيلَ لَهُمْ لَا تُنْقِصُوا مِنْ لِبْنِكُمْ شَيْئًا بَلْ فَرِيضَةً كُلَّ يَوْمٍ فِي
Hymn.English: 4 I have also established My covenant with them, to give them the land of Canaan, the land of their pilgrimage, in which they were strangers.

Hymn.Arabic: يَوْمِهَا.
Hymn.English: 5 And I have also heard the groaning of the children of Israel whom the Egyptians keep in bondage, and I have remembered My covenant.

Hymn.Arabic: وَصَادَفُوا مُوسَى وَهَارُونَ وَهُمَا وَاقِفَانِ لِلِقَائِهِمْ عِنْدَ خُرُوجِهِمْ مِنْ عِنْدِ فِرْعَوْنَ .
Hymn.English: 6 Therefore say to the children of Israel: `I am the Lord; I will bring you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians, I will rescue you from their bondage, and I will redeem you with an outstretched arm and with great judgments.

Hymn.Arabic: فَقَالُوا لَهُمَا: " يَنْظُرُ الرَّبُّ وَيَحْكُمُ عَلَيْكُمَا ، لِأَنَّكُمَا أَنْتَنْتُمَا رَائِحَتَنَا فِي عَيْنَي فِرْعَوْنَ وَفِي عُيُونِ عَبِيدِهِ
Hymn.English: 7 `I will take you as My people, and I will be your God. Then you shall know that I am the Lord your God who brings you out from under the burdens of the Egyptians.

Hymn.Arabic: وَجَعَلْتُمَا فِي أَيْدِيهِمْ سَيْفًا لِيَقْتُلُونَا ".
Hymn.English: 8 `And I will bring you into the land which I swore to give to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob; and I will give it to you as a heritage: I am the Lord.'

Hymn.Arabic: فَرَجَعَ مُوسَى إِلَى الرَّبِّ وَقَالَ : " يَا رَبُّ ، لِمَاذَا ابْتَلَيْتَ هَذَا الشَّعْبَ ؟ لِمَاذَا بَعَثْتَنِي ؟
Hymn.English: 9 So Moses spoke thus to the children of Israel; but they did not heed Moses, because of anguish of spirit and cruel bondage.

Hymn.Arabic: فَإِنِّي مُنْذُ دَخَلْتُ عَلَى فِرْعَوْنَ لِأَتَكَلَّمَ بِاسْمِكَ ، أَسَاءَ إِلَى هَذَا الشَّعْبِ. وَأَنْتَ لَمْ تُنْقِذْ شَعْبَكَ ".
Hymn.English: 10 And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying,

Hymn.Arabic: فَقَالَ الرَّبُّ لِمُوسَى: " الْآنَ تَرَى مَا أَصْنَعُ بِفِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّهُ بِيَدٍ قَدِيرَةِ سَيُطْلِقُهُمْ ، وَبِيَدٍ قَدِيرَةِ سَيَطْرُدُهُمْ مِنْ
Hymn.English: 11 Go in, tell Pharaoh king of Egypt to let the children of Israel go out of his land.

Hymn.Arabic: أَرْضِهِ ".
Hymn.English: 12 And Moses spoke before the Lord, saying, The children of Israel have not heeded me. How then shall Pharaoh heed me, for I am of uncircumcised lips?

Hymn.Arabic: وَكَلَّمَ اللَّهُ مُوسَى وَقَالَ لَهُ: " أَنَا الرَّبُّ.
Hymn.English: 13 Then the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, and gave them a command for the children of Israel and for Pharaoh king of Egypt, to bring the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt.
